alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 6:01PM EDT until June 17 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern St. Marys County in southern Maryland... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 600 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Saint Clements Bay, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...A wind gust to 67 mph was measured at Cobb Point Buoy. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Lexington Park, Piney Point, Tall Timbers, Saint Inigoes Creek, Saint Marys City, Saint George Island, Saint Clements Bay, Saint Marys River, White Point Beach, California, Abell, Valley Lee, Scotland, Great Mills, Avenue, Drayden, Saint Inigoes, Park Hall, Oakley and Dameron. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
